steps.intro: Learn how to create instantly No Code Apps

steps.title: You can use one of our Single Sign On options here. We also support SAMLv2 and LDAP for Enterprises
steps.intro: Please, select an authentication method to proceed to next step.

steps.title: Here is your dashboard. In here you will find all your apps you are building.
steps.intro:
Also you will see here the "Published App" and the "No Code Database" Tabs.
  • Click on "Published Apps" to see all the applications you published and those that are shared with you.
  • Click on "No Code Database" to list all thedata bases that have been created by you or shared with you.

steps.title: Let's add a new App!
steps.intro:
Click the + icon to create a new Form
and name it "Demo App". Click the Save button to validate.

steps.title: Just name it Demo App
We have here a GDPR notice a system administrator may have configured, just click ont it, once read.
Click on a section to modify and configure it
In here, we will write a short description about our app. You can use all the editing tool options such as formatting, fonts, images etc...
steps.intro: Type "This is my Demo App!" and center the text.

steps.title: And then validate our section
We will now drag a "Text description" to our page
steps.intro: Or you can double-click the section to automatically add it at the end of the Form

steps.title: And click on the section to configure it
Again, let's write some text to describe this section
And validate
We will now use a "Data grid" to display data from the No Code database
The grid is now installed, let's click on the section to configure it
To see all the Advanced options, click on the "A" button
We set the option to size all to columns to fit in the grid
We now are going to configure the data source for this grid
Among many other data sources, we will choose our Integrated Baserow No Code database source
We select the operation to do. In this case "Get data" to retreive data form the database
And validate
Now we just have to configure the data source
We select the database from where we want the data
Then the table where the data resides in
We unselect all the columns
And select only the one we want

And here!
We will reorder the columns
And this one too
And validate
We validate the data grid configuration
Et voila! let's see our app in action!
